summary: An email from an Assistant U.S. Attorney in the Southern District of New York requesting assistance with unzipping and organizing a significant production of documents received in the Epstein case. The email emphasizes the importance of careful handling to prevent data loss.

persons.name: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York
persons.context: The sender of the email, requesting technical assistance with processing a large document production in the Epstein case.

events.title: Document Production Received in Epstein Case
events.description: The Southern District of New York has received a significant production of documents related to the Epstein case, stored in 16 .zip folders.
personsInvolved: Assistant U.S. Attorney Southern District of New York

keyFacts: A significant document production in the Epstein case was received by the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York as of April 2019.
The production consisted of 16 .zip folders that required careful, manual extraction to a local drive before being transferred to a shared drive to avoid data loss.
The email indicates the prosecution team was handling sensitive case materials directly, bypassing standard IT or intern support to ensure proper chain of custody.
